means: watch ： 指用眼睛跟随某物，以便对每一个变化、运动等进行观察。
observe ： 侧重以客观的态度进行观察。
witness ： 指当场看见，亲眼看见。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"证据，见证"之意。
means: proof ： 指足以直接证明某事为某事实的依据，侧重作为充分证据所导致的结果。
evidence ： 普通用词，在法律上指能起证明作用的，如证明、公证书以及所有的实物东西等。在生活中指任何一样可证明某一件事的真实性的东西。
witness ： 指证据或证人，尤指后者，且有亲眼见到之意。
testimony ： 指证据、证词，多系法律用语。

sentence.Network_en: His girlfriend had gone into the witness box and taken the oath.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的女朋友进入证人席并立了誓。

sentence.Network_en: The plaintiff's sole witness, a gambler and layabout, was easily discredited.
sentence.Network_cn: 原告唯一的证人嗜赌成性，游手好闲，其证词一下子就被推翻了。

sentence.Network_en: The convictions rest solely on disputed witness and confessional statements.
sentence.Network_cn: 仅仅根据有争议的目击者证言和供词就定了罪。

list.abs: 花语_互动百科 ... 休憩（ Rest） 才智（wit）（ Wit） 感化（ Influence）.
带机智（wit）地把话说出来，让人感到其中的机锋。」 反讽是建立在「讽刺」的基础上，而带有「幽默」（humor）和机智的色彩。
While touring India with a Rotarian friend , she witnessed extreme poverty for the first time ., 她和一个扶轮社员朋友同游印度时 , 首次亲眼目睹赤贫的惨况.

phrase.cizu_name: as God is my witness (或 God be my witness)

jx.jx_en_mean: an invocation of God as confirmation of the truth of a statement
jx.jx_cn_mean: 上帝作证，老天作证（用于确认事实）

lj.lj_ly: God be my witness, sir, I didn't!.

phrase.cizu_name: call someone or something to witness

jx.jx_en_mean: (archaic)appeal or refer to someone or something for confirmation or evidence of something

encyclopedia.content: witness ,名词汉译：1目击者；见证人。2证人；证物；连署人。3证词。4证据，证明。动词汉译：1目击。2作。..的证人；连署等。

entry.def: A witness to an event such as an accident or crime is a person who saw it.

example.ex: Witnesses to the crash say they saw an explosion just before the disaster...
example.tran: 空难目击者称，就在灾难发生之前他们看见飞机发生了爆炸。

entry.def: If you witness something, you see it happen.

example.ex: Anyone who witnessed the attack should call the police...
example.tran: 目睹这次袭击的人都应向警方报告。

example.ex: It was the quickest swimming lesson I'd ever witnessed.
example.tran: 这是我所见过的最速成的游泳课。

entry.def: A witness is someone who appears in a court of law to say what they know about a crime or other event.

example.ex: In the next three or four days, eleven witnesses will be called to testify.
example.tran: 接下来的三四天里，将传唤11名证人出庭作证。

entry.def: A witness is someone who writes their name on a document that you have signed, to confirm that it really is your signature.

entry.tran: 为(文件的签署)作证;连署
entry.def: If someone witnesses your signature on a document, they write their name after it, to confirm that it really is your signature.

example.ex: Ask a friend to witness your signature.
example.tran: 请一位朋友给你的签名作证。

entry.def: If you say that a place, period of time, or person witnessed a particular event or change, you mean that it happened in that place, during that period of time, or while that person was alive.

example.ex: India has witnessed many political changes in recent years...
example.tran: 印度近年来经历了很多政治变动。

example.ex: The year 1886 witnessed the first extended translation into English of the writings of Eliphas Levi...
example.tran: 1886年，埃利法斯·莱维的作品第一次有了长篇英译本。

entry.def: You use witness to introduce an example of what you have just been talking about.

example.ex: Americans are a generous people: witness the increase in charitable giving, even during the recession.
example.tran: 美国人是个慷慨的民族：即使是在经济萧条时期，慈善捐赠也在不断增加，这便是明证。

entry.tran: 是…的见证人;是…的目击者
entry.def: If you are witness to something, you see it happen.

example.ex: Too often children are witness to a disturbing amount of violence.
example.tran: 孩子们经常会目睹暴力事件,其数量之多令人不安。

entry.def: If a person or thing bears witness to something, they show or say that it exists or happened.

example.ex: Many of these poems bear witness to his years spent in India and China...
example.tran: 这些诗中有很多见证了他在印度和中国度过的岁月。

example.ex: Many veterans believe it is their job to bear witness to the horrors of war that they personally experienced.
example.tran: 很多老兵认为他们有职责为他们亲身经历的战争的恐怖作证。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who sees an event and reports what happened
2. a close observer; someone who looks at something (such as an exhibition of some kind);
3. testimony by word or deed to your religious faith
4. (law) a person who attests to the genuineness of a document or signature by adding their own signature
5. (law) a person who testifies under oath in a court of law

sentences.sentence: "You'll see a lot of cheating in this school"
"The 1960 saw the rebellion of the younger generation against established traditions"

auth_sentence.content: This week will witness an extraordinary juxtaposition of events.
auth_sentence.res_content: This week will witness an extraordinary juxtaposition of events.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This week will witness an extraordinary juxtaposition of events.

auth_sentence.content: He did not want a single witness left alive.
auth_sentence.res_content: He did not want a single witness left alive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He did not want a single witness left alive.

auth_sentence.content: The facts given by the witness are highly questionable.
auth_sentence.res_content: The facts given by the witness are highly questionable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The facts given by the witness are highly questionable.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 智力, 才智, 智慧
stems_affixes.word_buile: wit智慧,观察→n.智力, 才智, 智慧

stems_affixes.value_cn: 证人, 目击者;证明, 证词
stems_affixes.word_buile: wit智慧,观察+ness表名词→n.证人, 目击者;证明, 证词

Sentence.sentence: She was a witness to the crime.
Many factors influence the accuracy of witness testimony.
At Jackson's trial, although two witnesses testified that Jackson was with them in another location at the times of the crimes, he was convicted anyway.
For instance, witnesses sometimes see photographs of several suspects before they try to identify the person they saw in a lineup of people

sentences.en: She was a witness of the incident.
A witness was examined by him in a court of law.
sentences.cn: 他在法庭上质问一个证人。

sentences.en: He gave witness on behalf of an accused person.

sentences.cn: 我亲眼目睹了这场事故。

sentences.en: No one could witness that he was present.
sentences.cn: 没有人能证明他在现场。

sentences.en: Severe damage witnessed the destructive force of the storm.
sentences.cn: 严重的损失表明了这场暴风雨巨大的破坏力。

jushi.english: His clothes are a witness to his poverty.
jushi.chinese: 他的穿着可以证明他穷。

jushi.english: She was a witness of the incident.
jushi.chinese: 她是这起事件的目击者。

jushi.english: A witness was examined by him in a court of law.
jushi.chinese: 他在法庭上询问一个证人。
